findings.title: Reentrancy in CashOut
findings.explanation: The function makes an external call to msg.sender (`msg.sender.call.value(_am)()`) before updating the user's balance. A malicious fallback can reenter and drain more than their balance.

findings.title: Missing overflow/underflow checks on balances
findings.explanation: The contract uses `balances[msg.sender] += msg.value` and `balances[msg.sender] -= _am` without SafeMath or any checks. Though the logic guard `_am <= balances[msg.sender]` prevents an underflow in CashOut, an attacker sending an extremely large value could overflow the balance mapping in Deposit.

findings.title: Dependence on external Log contract can cause DoS
findings.explanation: Both Deposit and CashOut unconditionally call `TransferLog.AddMessage(...)`. If the Log contract ever reverts (e.g., out of gas, or maliciously), then no one can deposit or withdraw any funds.

unmatched_predictions.title: Dependence on external Log contract can cause DoS
